results.title: The "A" list
results.brief_description: A charming digital animation from Australia’s premier centre for animation and interactive media ‘ RMIT AIM. Anyone who has tried to get into the ‘cool’ group at school will relate to this tale about jumping from the highest diving board.

results.title: The 'Shop steward'
results.creator_credit: Morten Parker, Guy Glover and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A dramatized presentation of the role of the shop steward in the effective day-to-day funtioning of free trade unionism. The film beings with the election of machinists Johnny Walachuk as shop steward for the men in his section of a large industrial plant. Continuing, it shows the part the shop steward plays in carrying out the grievance procedures set up by company and union. How Johnny fulfills responsibility to protect from infractions of the agreement the men who elected him, is told in his own words and typifies the function of the union shop stewards generally in Canada.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Morten Parker, Guy Glover and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The 'Burbs
results.creator_credit: Imagine Entertainment, Rosanna Norton, Joe Dante, Dana Olsen, James H. Spencer, Larry Brezner and Michael Finnell
results.brief_description: When secretive new neighbors move in next door, suburbanite Ray Peterson and his friends let their paranoia get the best of them as they start to suspect the newcomers of evildoings and commence an investigation. But it’s hardly how Ray, who much prefers drinking beer, reading his newspaper and watching a ball game on the tube expected to spend his vacation.

constellations_other.name: Suburbia and surveillance
constellations_other.description: Tru-Vue and View-Masters allow users to look through view finders and discover new worlds and perspectives, something also explored through many films and TV shows, where watching often reveals secrets, truth and even illusions.

results.title: Thaumatropes
results.brief_description: A thaumatrope is an optical toy that binds a disc to lengths of string. Illustrated on each side of the disc are distinct images that become one when you pull the string and the thaumatrope spins.

constellations_primary.name: There's always a lighthouse
constellations_primary.description: The thaumatrope was an early optical illusion device popular in the Victorian era and was important to the development of the moving image.

results.description: How do you cage a bird? With a thaumatrope, an optical toy that binds a disc to lengths of string. Illustrated on each side of the disc are distinct images that become one when you pull the string and the thaumatrope spins. The first known thaumatrope was invented by John Ayrton Paris in 1824, when he used it to demonstrate his theory of â€˜persistence of visionâ€™ to Londonâ€™s Royal College of Physicians.

results.title: Thatching
results.creator_credit: Angus MacAskill, E. Lawrence Couter and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: The film details a process important to house-building in England and the early New England colonies. Using authentic tools and techniques, a seasoned worker at the Plimoth Plantation in Massachusetts thatches the roof of a newly constructed cottage. The film covers all steps, which usually takes one man from eight to ten weeks to complete.

results.title: That was rock: the TAMI/TNT Show
results.brief_description: Introduced and presented by Chuck Berry this video captures the essence of the sixties - the music, the dancing, the fashion and the culture. A wonderful trip down memory lane especially for the baby-boomers out there. Features magical performances by Chuck Berry, James Brown, Ray Charles and his Orchestra, Bo Diddley, Marvin Gaye, Gerry and the Pacemakers, Leslie Gore, Jan and Dean, Smokey Robinson and the Miracles, The Ronettes, The Rolling Stones, The Supremes, and Ike and Tina Turner and includes among the 37 songs, “Baby love” (The Supremes), “Time is on my side” (The Rolling Stones) and “You don’t own me” (Leslie Gore). Music directors - Jack Nitsche, Phil Spector.

results.title: That Thing You Do!
results.creator_credit: Clinica Estetico, Clavius Base, 20th Century Fox, Tom Hanks, Colleen Atwood, Jonathan Demme, Edward Saxon and Gary Goetzman
results.brief_description: A Pennsylvania band scores a hit in 1964 and rides the star-making machinery as long as it can, with lots of help from its manager.

constellations_other.name: Conflict to cartoons
constellations_other.description: The Bell and Howell Filmo 70DR was a durable, 16mm camera frequently used by combat photographers like Robert Capa during the Spanish Civil War and Australian Neil Davis in the Vietnam War, but this Constellation goes to some much brighter places.

results.title: That they may live
results.creator_credit: Scott Peters, David Adams and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Presents direct artificial respiration, showing that mouth-to-mouth breathing is the best method being easier, more efficient and so simple children can learn it. Demonstrates the steps involved and illustrates its value with a series of varied and dramatic incidents.
